programme.title: Film: Miracle on 34th Street
programme.desc: An elderly gentleman named Kris Kringle creates a stir when he's hired as Macy's in-store Santa Claus for the holiday season. Comedy, Drama: 1947 (U)

programme.title: Up Pompeii!
programme.desc: Frankie Howerd plays Lurcio the slave in mid-70s BC Pompeii. Lurcio has to help his master Ludicrus Sextus find a virgin for the annual vestal virgin festival. S1 E1: Vestal Virgins

programme.title: Up Pompeii!
programme.desc: Frankie Howerd plays Lurcio the slave in mid-70s B.C. Pompeii in the classic series. Lurcio has been ordered by his master to assassinate Caesar, but are we seeing double? S1 E2: The Ides of March

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson stars as the hapless Mr. Bean. In this original award-winning episode, he takes an exam, sunbathes and goes to church with Richard Briers. Ep1: Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean turns the most ordinary situations into moments of excruciating embarrassment as he visits a department store and gets carried away. E2: The Return of Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean goes to a swimming pool but struggles with the diving board, attempts to leave a car park in style and demonstrates some sandwich-making. E3: The Curse of Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean buys a TV and a new camera but has issues with both; meanwhile, he ends up in another pickle when he goes to a magic show and a disco. E4: Mr. Bean Goes to Town

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean gets to an appointment with the dentist after oversleeping and has trouble in the park with a bothersome fly. E5: The Trouble with Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson creates more comic mayhem as Mr. Bean comes to the aid of a heart attack victim, fails miserably to post a letter, and flies off on holiday. E6: Mr. Bean Rides Again

programme.title: Mr. Bean Xmas 1992
programme.desc: Mr. Bean wreaks havoc at Harrods when he goes Christmas shopping, then has trouble stuffing a turkey on Christmas Day. E7: Merry Christmas, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr Bean's Bank Holiday
programme.desc: More hilarious mishaps with the bumbling Mr. Bean, this time as he books into a hotel room and makes himself well and truly at home but locks himself out. E8: Mr. Bean in Room 426

programme.title: Mr. Bean New Year
programme.desc: Mr. Bean loses midnight on New Year's Eve, devises an unusual method of transporting his sales shopping home, and wreaks havoc by doing a spot of decorating. E9: Do-It-Yourself, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean goes to the funfair and ends up having to watch over a baby; will the mother find them in time? E10: Mind the Baby, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: When the hapless bumbler Mr. Bean goes back to school, he scares a boy in the chemistry lab and the nudes in the art class cause him to look at the floor. E11: Back to School, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: It turns our that Mr. Bean isn't very good at looking after things in a laundrette, and he later has difficulty keeping control of his ball during a round of mini golf. E12: Tee Off, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: More mayhem with hapless bumbler Mr. Bean as he struggles to wait in line for an appointment and thinks up some unusual methods to help him sleep. E13: Goodnight Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: The blunderingly inept master of disaster goes for a haircut - but ends up styling the other customers' hair - and causes chaos at a school fun day. E14: Hair by Mr. Bean of London

programme.desc: Terry considers leaving to get a job in Berwick when appalled by the changes in Newcastle, but his friend's wanderlust has set Bob thinking. S1 E4: Moving On

programme.title: Are You Being Served? Again!
programme.desc: Young Mr Grace has died and the Grace Brothers department store has closed when the former staff attend a reading of his will and find that they have inherited a hotel. S1 E1: Grace & Favour

programme.title: Are You Being Served? Again!
programme.desc: The former staff of Grace Brothers are settling into their new roles after their first night in their own hotel, but they need money to get the hotel up and running. S1 E2: Grace & Favour

programme.title: Are You Being Served? Again!
programme.desc: Mrs Slocombe finds herself in court for stealing a horse-drawn cart, and Mr Humphries' relationship with Mavis Moulterd continues to develop. S1 E3: Grace & Favour

programme.title: Are You Being Served? Again!
programme.desc: A party of Americans stay at the Millstone Country Hotel for a weekend - it means £1,000 plus tips, so the staff set about bringing the ageing hotel up to scratch. S1 E4: Grace & Favour

programme.title: Are You Being Served? Again!
programme.desc: When the interviews for staff fail miserably, the former Grace Brothers team work at their own hotel and a storm knocks out the electricity in the night with scary results. S1 E5: Grace & Favour

programme.title: Are You Being Served? Again!
programme.desc: The former staff of Grace Brothers have now taken on their new roles as staff at the Millstone Country Hotel, but they're having trouble settling in. S1 E6: Grace & Favour

programme.title: Are You Being Served? Again!
programme.desc: Mavis Moulterd has still got a passionate crush on Mr Humphries. Mrs Slocombe gets a letter from an old friend, and Captain Peacock finds a loaded gun in the writing room. S2 E1

programme.title: Are You Being Served? Again!
programme.desc: The staff continue the tradition of hosting and taking part in a cricket match, but preparations don't go quite as smoothly as expected. S2 E2

programme.title: Are You Being Served? Again!
programme.desc: Mrs Slocombe is stunned when her long-lost husband appears to have made enquiries about buying the hotel... especially since he's been missing since he went to a supermarket in 1942. S2 E3

programme.title: Are You Being Served? Again!
programme.desc: Captain Peacock discovers a dead cat hidden behind one of the walls - after the staff get rid of it, they find out that it was put in the hotel to cancel out bad luck. S2 E4

programme.title: Are You Being Served? Again!
programme.desc: It seems that Mr Rumbold's wife has left him - which has made him more pompous - when he gets a vote of no confidence, and the staff agree to play a darts match with the villagers. S2 E5

programme.title: Are You Being Served? Again!
programme.desc: A group of businessmen due to stay at the manor are expecting some culture, Shakespeare and opera, but there seems to be only one answer with no money to spend on entertainment. S2 E6

programme.title: Bread Xmas 1989
programme.desc: Christmas for the Boswells brings its usual mix of hilarity, sadness and surprises; Nellie and Jack get to see some turkeys, and the family have their Christmas presents stolen. Christmas Special 1989

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: Sammy convinces Monty that he is ready for his debut at Neptune's with an impromptu performance for a devout fan - meanwhile, Noreen senses the arrival of her twin sister Doreen. S10 E6

programme.title: Shameless
programme.desc: A drunken night out turns into a nightmare for Frank when he mistakes an electrical generator for a urinal. Hospital tests reveal that he has a heart condition and may not last to the weekend. S5 E1

programme.title: Rising Damp Xmas 1975
programme.desc: Classic sitcom about a miserly landlord. Rigsby faces the prospect of a lonely Christmas until Alan and Philip arrive unexpectedly. S2 E8: For the Man Who Has Everything (Christmas Special 1975)

programme.desc: As Christmas approaches Alf Garnett's problems increase - but things are eventually resolved by Caribbean magic. In Sickness and in Health Christmas Special 1986

programme.title: Shameless
programme.desc: Debbie's enjoying having her dad back in the house, but when Monica gets jealous of the attention Debbie's getting, she tells her it's time she got a boyfriend. S4 E5

programme.title: Duty Free Xmas 1986

programme.desc: Alastair Sim stars as Ebenezer Scrooge, a curmudgeonly miserly businessman who has no time for Christmas, but he gets a visit from three spirits who show him the errors of his ways. Drama. 1951 (U)

programme.desc: While others have turkey, all that Alf Garnett has to look forward to is cheese so he decides to follow the advice: 'The Lord helps those who help themselves'. In Sickness and In Health Xmas 1989

programme.title: Some Mothers: Best Of
programme.desc: A host of celebrities select their favourite scenes from Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em. Featuring Christopher Biggins, Bobby Davro, Mariella Frostrup, Keith Chegwin, Claire Rayner, Glenys Kinnock and more

programme.title: Birds of a Feather Xmas 2014
programme.desc: Dorien is treating Sharon and Tracey to a Christmas trip to the Canary Islands; with an overdramatic passenger also on board, the plane does not reach its destination. S11 E1: Birds on a Plane

programme.title: Birds of a Feather Xmas 2016
programme.desc: When Travis goes missing in Morocco, Sharon, Tracey and Dorien move heaven and earth to track him down and bring him home for Christmas. 2016 Christmas Special: There's a Girl in My Souk

programme.title: Birds of a Feather Xmas 2017
programme.desc: Tracey has got big plans that could upset the festive harmony, Sharon has found a novel way of doing her Christmas shopping, and Dorien has got a mystery to solve. 2017: The House for the Rising Sons

programme.title: Birds of a Feather Xmas 2020
programme.desc: Tracey and Dorien have been cooped up during lockdown, Dorien is back to her old tricks with a rich dentist, and Sharon is stuck abroad in Costa Rica. Christmas 2020: We Gotta Get Out of this Place

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: Terry tries to track down some of his old flames, but probing into the past produces embarrassing results. S1 E5: I'll Never Forget Whatshername

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: Terry is depressed when everyone including his mother forgets his birthday; Bob throws a surprise party to make up for it, but preparations for the bash don't go according to plan. S1 E6: Birthday Boy

programme.title: Likely Lads: No Hiding Place
programme.desc: Bob and Terry are desperate not to know the result of the England v Bulgaria football match, but will they succeed in their mission with eight hours to go? S1 E7: No Hiding Place

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: Bob thinks that Terry needs new friends, but inviting him to Alan and Brenda's trendy dinner party might not be such a great idea. S1 E8: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner?

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: Terry helps Bob move his most treasured possessions from his old house to the new one, but Thelma refuses to have his junk in their home. S1 E9: Storm in a Tea Chest

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: Terry is disappointed that Bob has asked someone else to be his best man - after a few drinks at the restaurant, they start to chat up a couple of pretty girls. S1 E10: The Old Magic

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: The lads decide to rebel when Mrs Chambers has grandiose plans for Thelma's wedding to Bob that leave the men feeling overwhelmed. S1 E11: Countdown

programme.title: Ronnie Barker: The Best Of
programme.desc: The finest comedy moments from Ronnie Barker. Featuring classic footage from his decades of TV work including The Two Ronnies and Porridge. With Ronnie Corbett and rare archive material.

programme.desc: Joyce is furious with Monty and Sam, so they plot to get rid of Sammy - meanwhile, Doreen introduces a shell-shocked Pauline to her new boyfriend and sends her saucy novel to publishers. S10 E7

programme.desc: A thoughtless comment from an ex-boyfriend makes Mimi face up to her weight issues. S5 E2

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: Terry is horrified when Bob refuses to go on a stag night and insists on a quiet night in, but pre-wedding nerves mean that Bob's plan to celebrate his nuptials sober goes awry. S1 E12: Boys' Night In

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: The day of the wedding dawns - the women are racing around getting ready for the big event while Terry has his hands full looking after a nervous Bob. S1 E13: End of an Era

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: Bob and Thelma are on a Norwegian honeymoon far away from the influence of Terry - or so they think - and Terry is striving to get to know Thelma's sister Susan a lot better. S2 E1: Absent Friends

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: Bob comes back from his honeymoon to find that Terry is off his beer and is going out with Thelma's sister Susan - is Terry in love? S2 E2: Heart to Heart

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: Bob's married life promises work, worry and wallpapering; Terry wastes the days away in the pub and the bookies as happy as ever. Bob wonders who has the right answer. S2E3: The Ant & the Grasshopper

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: According to Bob and Shakespeare, 'wine is a gentle stimulant and good companion' - and so is Terry on the night Bob gets breathalysed. S2 E4: One for the Road

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: Bob and Terry argue about fitness over a pint and challenge each other to a cross-country cycle race to see who's the fittest. S2 E5: The Great Race

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: Terry suggests he look after the house when Bob and Thelma go away to Scotland for the weekend, but he has an ulterior motive for making such a generous offer. S2 E6: Someday We'll Laugh about This

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: Bob is in pain from an injury caused by Terry's shoddy DIY when he goes to the hospital - Terry is working there as a porter, but his attempts to help Bob only cause more harm. S2 E7: In Harm's Way

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: Bob takes time off from marriage to join Terry on a quiet weekend's fishing - Bob is racked by guilt, but he's not the guilty party. S2 E8: Affairs and Relations

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: Thelma has gone back to her mother and left Bob to bemoan his fate. S2 E9: The Expert

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: Thelma has left Bob and is still with her mother - she has left Terry to soothe Bob's furrowed brow, but Bob is anxious in case people talk. S2 E10: Between Ourselves

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: When Bob becomes more and more depressed by Thelma's absence and Terry's housekeeping, Terry can finally take no more and leaves him as well. S2 E11: The Go-Between

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: When faced with a fight, Terry has a golden rule: 'Do unto others as they would do unto you - but do it first'. S2E12: Conduct Unbecoming

programme.title: Likely Lads: Whatever Happened?
programme.desc: The death of disreputable old Uncle Jacob is received by the Collier family with a mixture of regret and relief as the funeral gives Bob an insight into his future. S2 E13: The Shape of Things to Come

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson stars as the hapless Mr. Bean. In this original award-winning episode, he takes an exam, sunbathes and goes to church with Richard Briers. Ep1: Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean turns the most ordinary situations into moments of excruciating embarrassment as he visits a department store and gets carried away. E2: The Return of Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean goes to a swimming pool but struggles with the diving board, attempts to leave a car park in style and demonstrates some sandwich-making. E3: The Curse of Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean buys a TV and a new camera but has issues with both; meanwhile, he ends up in another pickle when he goes to a magic show and a disco. E4: Mr. Bean Goes to Town

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean gets to an appointment with the dentist after oversleeping and has trouble in the park with a bothersome fly. E5: The Trouble with Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson creates more comic mayhem as Mr. Bean comes to the aid of a heart attack victim, fails miserably to post a letter, and flies off on holiday. E6: Mr. Bean Rides Again

programme.title: Mr. Bean Xmas 1992
programme.desc: Mr. Bean wreaks havoc at Harrods when he goes Christmas shopping, then has trouble stuffing a turkey on Christmas Day. E7: Merry Christmas, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr Bean's Bank Holiday
programme.desc: More hilarious mishaps with the bumbling Mr. Bean, this time as he books into a hotel room and makes himself well and truly at home but locks himself out. E8: Mr. Bean in Room 426

programme.title: Mr. Bean New Year
programme.desc: Mr. Bean loses midnight on New Year's Eve, devises an unusual method of transporting his sales shopping home, and wreaks havoc by doing a spot of decorating. E9: Do-It-Yourself, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby is looking for another lodger - one of his current lodgers, Miss Jones, is keen for her acquaintance Philip to move in because she is attracted to him. S1 E1: The New Lodger

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby becomes convinced that magic is real after Philip bangs a ritual spear on the floor - while Ruth tries to offer herself to Rigsby, Philip and Alan play a trick on him. S1 E2: Black Magic

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby is dressed to kill as he takes Miss Jones out to dinner to celebrate her birthday. S1 E3: A Night Out

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby is given some advice from Alan and Philip - as well as some tablets - to calm his nerves in his amorous pursuit of Miss Jones. S1 E4: Charisma

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Mr Spooner annoys the household by playing his radio loudly - Rigsby is annoyed, but he finds it difficult to pluck up the courage to confront him about it. S1 E5: All Our Yesterdays

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: When Miss Jones sees a prowler through her window, Rigsby suspects everyone else as a police detective appears and begins to investigate. S1 E6: The Prowler

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: An election polarises the household - Rigsby supports the Conservatives, Alan and Philip lean towards Labour, and Miss Jones is impressed with the Liberal candidate. S1 E7: Stand Up and Be Counted

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: When Ruth is depressed following the 'deception' of a recent male friend, Rigsby takes what he believes to be his chance to woo her. S2 E1: The Permissive Society

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Miss Jones is collecting for a famine charity when Philip challenges Rigsby to go 48 hours without eating - Rigsby gladly accepts the offer but soon finds his will weakening. S2 E2: Food Glorious Food

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Health and fitness are the new buzzwords in the house when Rigsby's keenness to portray himself in prime condition leads him to challenge Philip to a boxing match. S2 E3: A Body Like Mine

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: When Miss Jones becomes engaged to a librarian and looks set to move out, Rigsby is distraught but is determined that no other man should have her. S2 E4: Moonlight and Roses

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby has found a new lodger called Seymour who is staying in town away from his country estate, but Philip and Alan aren't quite as convinced of his authenticity. S2 E5: A Perfect Gentleman

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby is hoping to take new tenant Brenda out for the evening, but he has a cashflow problem and a string of unwelcome visitors who start arriving at the house. S2 E6: Last of the Big Spenders

programme.title: Goodnight Sweetheart Finale
programme.desc: It's 1962 and Gary Sparrow has been trapped in the past for 17 years, but his decision to witness his own birth sees him catapulted into the 21st century: Many Happy Returns (2016 Special)

programme.title: Shameless
programme.desc: When people think Frank's won the lottery, he's not about to say otherwise, with endless free drinks coming his way. S5 E4

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: The vicar calls asking for an article on rag-and-bone men for the church magazine's centenary edition; Harold writes the article but Albert makes the contribution of a crossword. S7 E1: Men of Letters

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: Harold joins the local amateur dramatic society; when rehearsals take place at the yard, Albert thinks he will give the acting lark a go as well. S7 E2: A Star Is Born

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: Albert receives news that his brother has died; a family funeral is held and the deceased Steptoe has the last laugh when his will is read out. S7 E3: Oh, What a Beautiful Mourning

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: Drastic action is needed when Albert gets a visit from the Inland Revenue investigating his claim for his wife who has been dead for 30 years. S7 E4: Live Now, P.A.Y.E. Later

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: Harold tries to kill Albert while sleepwalking, leading to a visit to a psychiatrist triggering memories of when Albert scared away Harold's girlfriend. Featuring Joanna Lumley. S7 E5: Loathe Story

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: Classic comedy with the rag-and-bone team. When the arguments become just too much for Harold, he decides to take drastic measures to get some peace from Albert. S7 E6: Divided We Stand

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: There's no electricity, no gas, no food, no booze and no fags. On top of that, two unwelcome visitors drop by - and they seem strangely familiar. Featuring Leonard Rossiter. S7 E7: The Desperate Hours

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Could rumours of the Grey Lady who haunts the house be true? Rigsby certainly believes so, but he has not seen her yet... S2 E7: Things That Go Bump In The Night

programme.title: Rising Damp Xmas 1975
programme.desc: Classic sitcom about a miserly landlord. Rigsby faces the prospect of a lonely Christmas until Alan and Philip arrive unexpectedly. S2 E8: For the Man Who Has Everything (Christmas Special 1975)

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby returns from a Spanish holiday to find Alan has let out the two spare rooms; he's happy Miss Jones has returned but less enthusiastic about a single mother and her baby. S3 E1: That's My Boy

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby attempts to have himself cast as male lead in a play written by effeminate lodger Hilary when he discovers that Ruth is playing the role of the love interest. S3 E2: Stage Struck

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby turns up at the house with a new sports car apparently purchased in yet another attempt to woo Miss Jones, but his driving doesn't appear to be as stylish as his motor. S3 E3: Clunk Click

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby is soon calling the Samaritans to stop a suicide attempt when a new lodger arrives at the house, but which of the residents will come off worse? S3 E4: The Good Samaritans

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: When Miss Jones raises suspicions about new tenant Madeline, Rigsby is not too bothered about her brand of 'modern interpretive dancing' but isn't that keen on her partner. S3 E5: Fawcett's Python

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Alan's getting serious about Caroline, but her parents are well-to-do and Rigsby is far from convinced that the young scruff could possibly make the relationship work. S3 E6: The Cocktail Hour

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: The house is plunged into confusion and mourning when Rigsby discovers basement tenant Mr Osborne stiff as a board. S3 E7: Suddenly At Home

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: A rude surprise lies in store when Rigsby is a little over-enthusiastic with advice after a couple of newlyweds move into the house. S4 E1: Hello Young Lovers

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: There's been a spare bed in Philip's room since Alan moved out, and Rigsby has no intentions of keeping it empty. S4 E2: Fire And Brimstone

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby is ecstatic to learn that he has inherited his Uncle George's fortune but distressed at a clause that he must be happily married. S4 E3: Great Expectations

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby decides to move on, give up on Miss Jones and file for divorce - he places an advert in the local newspaper, but his search for love doesn't run entirely smoothly. S4 E4: Pink Carnations

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: New resident Ambrose claims he has the power of hypnosis due to his gypsy blood - Rigsby is sceptical but soon wonders if Ambrose's abilities could be used in his favour. S4 E5: Under The Influence

programme.title: Rising Damp Finale
programme.desc: Rigsby finally pops the question to Miss Jones with his decree absolute at long last in hand, but will she accept? S4 E6: Come On In The Water's Lovely

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: Join boisterous Brits abroad at the Solana, as the iconic Benidorm returns for an all-inclusive trip in the sun. Swingers Donald and Jaqueline make new friends, as Madge takes the Garveys abroad. S1E1

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: The Oracle tries to beat a world record, enlisting the help of his mum Noreen. Martin and Kate go for a trip to the old town, and end up inadvertently seeing Sticky Vicky's infamous show. S1 E2

programme.title: Shameless
programme.desc: Shane falls for his perfect woman, but when she takes him back to her place, he's in for a surprise. S5 E5

programme.desc: Your favourite music from the 1980s non-stop. The soundtrack to your New Year's Eve celebrations. Get ready to paaarty!

programme.title: That's 80s - The Best Music
programme.desc: Your favourite music from the '80s non-stop.

programme.title: Kenny Everett New Year 1978
programme.desc: With Rod Stewart and Leo Sayer. Kenny Everett's special 'Didn't Quite Make it in Time for Christmas Video Show'.

programme.title: Kenny Everett New Year 1979
programme.desc: With David Bowie, Cliff Richard, Thin Lizzy, The Sex Pistols and Boomtown Rats. The famous New Year's Eve comedy show, but will Kenny Everett make it to 1980?

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: A photographer arrives at the yard and wants to use it for a fashion shoot, but there's a surprising volunteer when a male model is required. S8 E1: Back in Fashion

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: Harold's love life has collapsed and so has his bed - however, he discovers after splashing out on a waterbed that it's not the only time he will be splashing. S8 E2: And So to Bed

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: Harold brings home an old 'What the Butler Saw' machine but gets a surprise when he takes a look at the film inside; what will the vicar think at the church fete? S8 E3: Porn Yesterday

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: Local villain Frankie Barrow demands money with menaces from the Steptoes, so Albert hatches a scheme with the help of Shepherd Bush's answer to the Seven Samurai. S8 E4: The Seven Steptoerai

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: Albert has done his back in and runs Harold ragged with demands for help; after a bit of detective work, Harold deduces all is not quite as it seems. S8 E5: Upstairs, Downstairs, Upstairs, Downstairs

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: Clairvoyant Madame Fontana is invited to hold a seance at the Steptoes by Albert as he wants to get in touch with Harold's mother. S8 E6: Seance In a Wet Rag and Bone Yard

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson stars as the hapless Mr. Bean. In this original award-winning episode, he takes an exam, sunbathes and goes to church with Richard Briers. Ep1: Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean turns the most ordinary situations into moments of excruciating embarrassment as he visits a department store and gets carried away. E2: The Return of Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean goes to a swimming pool but struggles with the diving board, attempts to leave a car park in style and demonstrates some sandwich-making. E3: The Curse of Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean buys a TV and a new camera but has issues with both; meanwhile, he ends up in another pickle when he goes to a magic show and a disco. E4: Mr. Bean Goes to Town

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean gets to an appointment with the dentist after oversleeping and has trouble in the park with a bothersome fly. E5: The Trouble with Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson creates more comic mayhem as Mr. Bean comes to the aid of a heart attack victim, fails miserably to post a letter, and flies off on holiday. E6: Mr. Bean Rides Again

programme.title: Mr. Bean Xmas 1992
programme.desc: Mr. Bean wreaks havoc at Harrods when he goes Christmas shopping, then has trouble stuffing a turkey on Christmas Day. E7: Merry Christmas, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr Bean's Bank Holiday
programme.desc: More hilarious mishaps with the bumbling Mr. Bean, this time as he books into a hotel room and makes himself well and truly at home but locks himself out. E8: Mr. Bean in Room 426

programme.title: Mr. Bean New Year
programme.desc: Mr. Bean loses midnight on New Year's Eve, devises an unusual method of transporting his sales shopping home, and wreaks havoc by doing a spot of decorating. E9: Do-It-Yourself, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean goes to the funfair and ends up having to watch over a baby; will the mother find them in time? E10: Mind the Baby, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: When the hapless bumbler Mr. Bean goes back to school, he scares a boy in the chemistry lab and the nudes in the art class cause him to look at the floor. E11: Back to School, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: It turns our that Mr. Bean isn't very good at looking after things in a laundrette, and he later has difficulty keeping control of his ball during a round of mini golf. E12: Tee Off, Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: More mayhem with hapless bumbler Mr. Bean as he struggles to wait in line for an appointment and thinks up some unusual methods to help him sleep. E13: Goodnight Mr. Bean

programme.title: Mr. Bean
programme.desc: The blunderingly inept master of disaster goes for a haircut - but ends up styling the other customers' hair - and causes chaos at a school fun day. E14: Hair by Mr. Bean of London

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: Mateo betrays his fiancée, leaving Donald and Jacqueline to console the heartbroken Brit. Kate, meanwhile, betrays Martin, and tries to keep it quiet. At karaoke, Geoff and Noreen sing a duet. S1 E3

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: Madge is shocked to discover Donald and Jacqueline's swinging habits, after taking them for a friendly and helpful couple. As Kate regrets her fling with Mateo, Martin enjoys blissful ignorance. S1 E4

programme.title: Shameless
programme.desc: A mishap with baby Katie and a bag of Es results in a stand-off between Mandy and Frank. S5 E6

programme.title: In Sickness and in Health
programme.desc: As Alf's wedding to Mrs Hollingbery approaches, the preparations unfold: present giving, Alf's stag night and finally the big event itself. S5 E10: Wedding

programme.title: In Sickness Xmas 1990
programme.desc: 1990 Christmas Special. Alf can't understand why Mrs Hollingbery jilted him and he's hardly full of Xmas spirit!
